text: Did we bring back the BDD tests into the CI as a valid check? Jenkins gave me a -1 but the unit tests passed, and the BDD tests failed, but they always fail...
<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/1975/>
We got circle-ci working for iroha: <https://circleci.com/gh/hyperledger/iroha>

attachments.title: Continuous Integration and Deployment
attachments.text: Hosted Continuous Integration for web applications. Set up your application for testing in one click, on the fastest testing platform on the internet.

text: what's circle-ci?
It’s a ci platform, like jenkins or travis.
From our experience, it seems to be the fastest and one of the easiest to use.
It costs money usually, but is free for open source projects.
can it integrate with gerrit?
no idea :slightly_smiling_face:
I am pretty sure you can put in any arbitrary git hook
<@U0ZJZBJLF> :  we are still skipping the result of BDD tests in CI pipeline. But if your patch set relates to BDD or if it impacts BDD tests, then please look into the failure
it's not....
then how did I get -1 from the CI if the unit tests succeeded? :confused:
<https://jenkins.hyperledger.org/job/fabric-verify-behave-x86_64/909/> : FAILURE (skipped)
overall build status is +1
I rebased, I could swear it was a red -1 :slightly_smiling_face:
nevermind though, now it's green
yes
<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/1911/>
this one succeeded and I don't see the +1 from jenkins
I don't see any error logs.. Could be network issue..
the +1 takes too long to reach the web server? :laughing:
the builds for 6 haven’t completed yet.
votes on builds 4 and 5 are discarded as 6 exists
opps I missed that. thanks ry

hi <@U11HH3P7Y>.  Could you please take a look at the Jobbuilder verify stage for my change <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/1939/>.  It looks like for the vagrant step the VM couldn't be started.
Error message: "Error starting VM: VBoxManage error"   .....  Thanks.
<@U0KPFAZNF> any inputs on the above error..

<@U0YK3KKCY> I retriggered the build to see if it repeats. I know ghaskins has run into intermittent vagrant issues which don’t reproduce in his setup. also, please note ghaskins is offline for the next week
<@U0UHG4VP1>, thanks very kindly.  much appreciated.
Please note there will be rolling outages in LF infra in general, and HLP infra specifically, as we roll out the Dirty COW mitigations today.
<@U0UHG4VP1> <@U11HH3P7Y>  Do I need to keep list of maintainers for fabric-sdk-java in a file?
where should it be?
pvishnum currently fabric is doing that here for instance: <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/gitweb?p=fabric.git;a=blob;f=docs/MAINTAINERS.md;h=1ef42eba6e81427eff09ef965d5f2842db826d5b;hb=HEAD>
pvishnum I suspect you could put that in / or docs/ if you like
ok.. Binh was mentioning gerritt can read that file and automatically grant right privileges
is that correct?
pvishnum it might be able to but it isn't configured to do so. I "automagically" update it by hand :slightly_smiling_face:
